Description: Terracotta model jar. A miniature Egyptian copy of a Levantine jar, with a low-placed carination and pointed but rounded base, narrow flat shoulder and raised rim; two lugs are placed on each side of the shoulder, where the full-sized jars have two opposed ring-handles. Probably wheel-made. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparandum. Close, but probably rather larger (no scale): Petrie 1889: pl. xiv:6, from Hawara.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3668)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.106, p.218, pl.60)
